html:
fear not, neither be fainthearted. King Ahaz had no need to fear the power of the kings of Syria and Israel, for the days of their power were numbered.

two tails of these smoking firebrands. A firebrand is smoldering wood. The might and majesty of Rezin and Pekah, who were once burning fires with the power to consume, were now nothing more than smoldering embers. The tails may symbolize two animals who are retreating from a battle.

son of Remaliah. Pekah was Remaliah's son.
